name: Bally V
overview: Bally V is one in the series of Qix clones mostly distributed on the gaming magazine cover disks at the time. The objective is to draw lines that close off parts of the screen to fill in a set amount of the playfield. Once the percentage is set you move on to the next level. If any of the enemies flying around touches your line while being drawn, you'll lose a life. What sets the Bally series from the other Qix clones are the graphics: both you and the enemies are single pixels.
